content: Is there documentation on how a project might customize the basic look and feel? Things like colors? And has this been tested to be effective with the history page? I have a nicely colored IG, but I can't figure out how to get the history page using anything other than HL7 red.
History page is a custom page that isn't generated or maintained as part of the IG - so anything you do with it is manual.
okay... so, can you give me some hints on how to change the hl7 red to some other color? I have been poking around blindly all afternoon.
what history page are you talking about?
I believe Jose's put some documentation in the 'guidance' IG
the history page that is created during the publication process
which publication process?
You can also look at the examples of the HL7 template, the CDA template, etc. All they do is change colors and add a logo.
like Lloyd said, the history page is special
hmm, I might have been cursed by browser caching.
my attempts have succeeded
https://profiles.ihe.net/fhir/ihe.formatcode.fhir/history.html
I thought I handled that for IHE (the removing of the red colors)
now I just need to figure out which hack worked, so that I can them put that into the IHE publication mechanism
I do think the process documentation works there (don't forget the last step otherwise the history page will have be red)

Jose Costa Teixeira said:

I thought I handled that for IHE (the removing of the red colors)

I think you said you had a solution that you had not yet committed.. so I went trying to solve it
it is there, i think
that "last step" solution ... you mean copying all of the assets to assets-hist?

step 10, yes
https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=104580055

that overrides the css for the assets-hist.
(there may be a cleaner way to handle this so that the history page gets the same css as the template provides, but hey, it's working)
so, yes that works
